markdownRemark.html:
At Sāvatthī.

Seated to one side, Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:

“Sir, they speak of things being ‘liable to end’. What is liable to end?”

“Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are liable to end.

Seeing this … They understand: ‘… there is no return to any state of existence.’”

SN.23.20. Vayadhammasutta (“Liable To Vanish”)

What is liable to end?”
“Rādha, form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness are liable to end.

Seeing this …
They understand: ‘… there is no return to any state of existence.’”
